Use insulation: Proper insulation can help retain heat during cold weather and keep the home cool during hot weather. This can be achieved through adding insulation to walls, windows, and doors.
Use area rugs: Place area rugs on cold floors to insulate them and make them more comfortable to walk on.
Use window treatments: Close windows and curtains during the day to keep the sun from heating the interior of the home, and open them at night to let in cool air.
Use fans: Use fans to circulate air and create a breeze, which can help cool the room.
Use the body: Use the body to generate heat by huddling under blankets during cold weather or using a hot bath to warm up.
